text: Hi Everyone.  I am a bit new to Julia.  I would like to interface Julia to another application on my PC perhaps via a web page.  I looked into WebIO.jl but I cannot figure out how to read/write to a web page via Julia.  Any thoughts please??????

elements.text: Hi Everyone.  I am a bit new to Julia.  I would like to interface Julia to another application on my PC perhaps via a web page.  I looked into WebIO.jl but I cannot figure out how to read/write to a web page via Julia.  Any thoughts please??????

text: why do you want to interface with another application via a web page?

elements.text: why do you want to interface with another application via a web page?

text: Hi Jerry.  What might the best way to interface Julia to another application running on my PC?  Note, the other application has the ability to run Java Scripts.

elements.text: Hi Jerry.  What might the best way to interface Julia to another application running on my PC?  Note, the other application has the ability to run Java Scripts.

text:
file socket, web socket etc. are both valid ways to "interface", I don't think Java is relevant here.

maybe it helps for you to say more about what program you're interfacing and what is the goal here

elements.text:
file socket, web socket etc. are both valid ways to "interface", I don't think Java is relevant here.

maybe it helps for you to say more about what program you're interfacing and what is the goal here

text: The other application is a power system simulator where I can write Java scripts to simulate various power situations.  From Julia, I want to read the  values from the power system simulator; run a Julia algorithm; then have Julia send back info to the power system simulator.

elements.text: The other application is a power system simulator where I can write Java scripts to simulate various power situations.  From Julia, I want to read the  values from the power system simulator; run a Julia algorithm; then have Julia send back info to the power system simulator.

text: and what interface the power system simulator provides? "can run a Java" doesn't sound like an interface more like a script loader

elements.text: and what interface the power system simulator provides? "can run a Java" doesn't sound like an interface more like a script loader

text: Per the developer of the power system simulator, the only interface it provides is via Java Scripts.

elements.text: Per the developer of the power system simulator, the only interface it provides is via Java Scripts.

text: is JavaScripts one word or two?

elements.text: is JavaScripts one word or two?

text: Java Scripts or JavaScript. (Damn Jerry was faster)
I am not sure!  The file extension is .js

elements.text: I am not sure!  The file extension is .js

text: that's web javascript

elements.text: that's web javascript

text: ok :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: ok

text: So, its only interface is web javascripts.

elements.text: So, its only interface is web javascripts.

text: you might want to just ask the developers what should you do if you want to interface their simulator with something else, like python / julia. It highly depends on how their program communicates
